column4: Does anybody know why if Ubuntu installs correctly, then when I try to boot from hard disk the computer hangs at a blinking cursor?
are you using an ati or nvidia card? the drivers installed might not do kms, or the login manager isn't able to restart
S3 Chrome
that might be a real problem
s3 devices are kind of a tough thing in linux
any idea of what might be causing it? It literally hangs before it even boots :|
ok, do you get a grub menu to pick the boot label?
ext4
if you hold shift when it boots does it show a grub menu?
tried what you told me to do, no GRUB menu (or anything for that matter)
also tried using doing it wiht the LiveCD and the LiveUSB, just to make sure I was doing it right (GRUB command line appears on those)
well, if it doesn't show grub theres a problem with it; i don't have the time at the moment to troubleshoot what, i _think_ that can happen when the bios map at install time for the drive is wrong
i didn't intend for you to ask directly, merely to give you a lead; you'll probably need to google around :\ (people here are good at fixing small simple things, that sort of problem isn't)
bro i got answers for you
huh?
first, use glxinfo it will tell you what is going on with rendering

second, open volume properties and pick the device you want to use; pulse has a list of rankings but sometimes it picks the wrong output when there are some with the same rank, if there's 2 it's 50/50 :D
the problem is that apparently the proper onboard sound drivers won't load unless it happens to be device #2
it is random, or rather; can't be trusted to be the same on every boot, but pulse should be using bus addresses and outputting to the one you set regardless
OK... now, how do I ensure it loads the proper drivers for the onboard sound always? (and the sound card is also hit and miss on getting it to work... ugh)
you shouldn't have to worry about the driver loading if it is indeed a pulse problem
alsactl reload or whatever might bypass module blacklisting, so i'd look there
er, whatever, at worst I'll have to load it manually, not like I boot every two seconds :P Will come back later if I outright can't get sound working again
